title: Use port specified in connection when running CheckHostAlive
author: bkbartk
body_snippet:
Hi, 

I made some changes but I'm not allowed to push them, so here are the details.
at the moment for hostAlive mRemoteNG does a ping,
in my own fork back then I changed this to connect to the used port because most servers do not allow ping anymore.
and I'm planning to backport some of the changes I made to mRemoteNG starting with this one.
in mRemoteV1\UI\Window\ConfigWindow.cs
method CheckHostAlive
should be changed like this
`
        private string _hostName;
        private int...

iterations.description: Host status currently ignores the connection-specific port and depends on ICMP ping, so checking the configured port will make status detection more accurate in common blocked-ping environments.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Makes sense. We should be able to get this in pretty easily

notes:
AI triage (codex): Host status currently ignores the connection-specific port and depends on ICMP ping, so checking the configured port will make status detection more accurate in common blocked-ping environments.
Approach: Pass ConnectionInfo into CheckHostAlive and perform a short-timeout TCP probe against info.Hostname:info.Port instead of ping, then add coverage for port-aware host status behavior.
